node.title: When Laura's father died, NDIA told her 86-year-old grandmother to look after her
node.alt: A young woman with a pony tail, wearing a grey t-shirt, sits at a kitchen table with a birthday cake in front of her
node.description: An 86-year-old grandmother grieving the sudden loss of her son isÂ told by the National Disability Insurance Agency to take over the care of his 24-year-old daughter, who lives with disabilities.
node.content:
["An 86-year-old grandmother grieving the sudden loss of her son has been told by the National Disability Insurance Agency (NDIA) to take over the care of his 24-year-old disabled daughter.", "Marlene Thatcher's 65-year-old son Shane Thatcher died in October.\u00a0", "His daughter, Laura, is intellectually disabled.", "Mr Thatcher raised Laura and her siblings, Liam, 25, and Riley, 21, on his own in Moonta, after his wife died from breast cancer in 2007.", "\"Mum and Dad were teachers at the same school so they enrolled Laura there so they were never far away,\" Laura's brother Liam said.", "He said his dad was able to juggle sole parenting and work, but when Laura finished school he left his job to take care of her full time.", "\"In terms of day-to-day care needs, she really needs someone to assist her,\" he said.", "\"That includes things like bathing, toileting, preparing food and navigating the community.\"", "Liam, a full-time disability appeals advocate, and Riley, a nursing student, both live in Adelaide.", "They \"temporarily\" relocated to Moonta to help their grandmother care for Laura while they looked for suitable accommodation for their sister to live in Adelaide.", "\"We put in a request to notify the NDIS (National Disability Insurance Scheme)\u00a0of a change of circumstance maybe a couple of days after Dad passed away, putting it front and centre that Laura needed some additional support for accommodation and things like that,\" Liam said.", "\"It took them two weeks to respond to that, which made us really anxious and quite concerned.", "Liam said when the department eventually did respond, he applied for increased NDIS funding for Laura so that she could live in a medium-level care facility.", "\"We had that planning meeting and it was another four weeks until the\u00a0NDIS gave us a new plan that unfortunately and unexpectedly didn't include any accommodation supports whatsoever for Laura, and no resources or anything like that to help us investigate those things going forward,\" he said.", "\"It was a real shock and completely unexpected.\"", "", "
Shane Thatcher, 65, died in October.(Supplied: Thatcher family)
", "Liam said when the family asked why the funding application was rejected, they were told the current arrangement seemed to be working.", "\"It seems like the NDIS is expecting Laura to reside with my grandma, with the assistance of the support worker, which in our view is grossly disproportionate to the support that Laura actually needs,\" he said.", "\"It expects far too much from my grandma who, while doing tremendously well for 86 years old, is not in a position to help care for Laura's really, really acute and significant care needs that require a lot of direct support.\"", "Mrs Thatcher said she was not able to give her granddaughter the same care she would receive in supported accommodation.", "\"Particularly at night. If anything happened, you know if I had a health crisis of some kind, Laura wouldn't be safe.", "\"She wouldn't understand and that would be very difficult.\"", "The family has appealed the NDIA's decision, a process that \u2014 at best \u2014 will take several months.", "Liam has remained in\u00a0Moonta to help care for Laura.", "He has been\u00a0working remotely and has had to reduce his work hours.", "", "
Laura Thatcher with her sister, Riley.(Supplied: Thatcher family)
", "Liam said he, his sisters and grandmother had been forced to cast their grief for Mr Thatcher aside to deal with the NDIS.", "\"It's tremendously tough,\" he said.", "\"I think\u00a0you sometimes close off a little bit in these sort of circumstances where we're having to sort of make calls about what we can focus on at any given day and for us at the moment that's caring for Laura.", "\"Not having that opportunity to grieve, as we need to do, has \u2026 been very difficult,\" Ms Thatcher added.", "
Cost-cutting to blame,\u00a0advocates say
", "Disability Advocacy Network Australia CEO\u00a0Mary Mallett\u00a0labelled the NDIA's decision to deny Laura funding for supported accommodation as unfair.", "She said she believed a push by the federal government to make the NDIS \"financially sustainable\" was to blame.", "\"As it is,\u00a0the NDIA has a relatively lean operational budget, in terms of the number of staff,\" she said.", "\"The only place they can take that money from is from the plans of the people who are already participants in the scheme.", "\"That's the only place it can be cut from.\"", "
NDIS participants forced into 'cruel'\u00a0and 'exhausting'\u00a0funding appeals
", "Advocates say\u00a0there has been a sharp rise in the number NDIS recipients whose funding has been cut and many are being forced into the Administrative Appeals Tribunal in a last-ditch attempt to get their supports reinstated.", "NDIS participants, their families and disability advocates say the National Disability Insurance Agency has been pitting\u00a0them against its lawyers, in what they've labelled an \"exhausting\" and \"cruel\" process that's driven by budget cuts.", "Adelaide Hills mother Lisa Trimboli's daughter Rose, 21, lives with autism and Tuberous Sclerosis \u2014 a rare disease that causes multiple benign tumours to grow on her brain, behind her eyes and on her kidneys.", "", "
The NDIA recently reviewed the funding of 21-year-old recipient Rose Trimboli.(Supplied: Trimboli family)
", "She also has an intellectual disability and does occupational, behavioural and art therapy.", "The National Disability Insurance Agency recently reviewed Rose's funding.", "Her mum Lisa said she has submitted 21 specialist reports detailing what her daughter's needs were and how much they would cost.", "When Rose's new plan arrived, it fell short by $112,000 a year.", "In a letter from the NDIA, the agency declared funding for occupational, behavioural and art therapy as well as increased respite care was \"not reasonable and necessary\".", "Ms Trimboli, who runs a farm with her husband and has two younger children, hopes\u00a0the AAT\u00a0will overturn the cuts.", "\"I've supplied the NDIS with 21 reports. It's just a full-time job. It's exhausting,\" she said.", "This will be the second time Lisa has had to go to the appeals tribunal for Rose.", "Last year, the National Disability Insurance Agency cut her transport funding.", "The AAT ordered that it be reinstated.", "Government data shows there has been a sharp rise in the number of appeals lodged with the tribunal by NDIS participants in recent years.", "Last financial year there were more than 2,100.", "In the first quarter of this financial year, the AAT had already received more than 1,200 appeals relating to the NDIS.", "Roen Mejers manages Tasmania-based disability advocacy group Your Say.", "\"Someone who\u00a0has had the same supports in their plan for several years with no change in their circumstances, they may have been through three or four plan reviews with no issues in the past, but this year suddenly they're finding that their plan has being slashed,\" Roen said.", "Roen\u00a0said\u00a0advocates in all states and territories were not\u00a0able to keep up with the demand for help.", "\"Clients often say, 'it feels like they're trying to wear me out so I'll go away',\" Roen\u00a0said.", "\"It might be a family with multiple children with disabilities that are just trying to get enough support to keep everything sustainable.\"", "Roen said\u00a0legal aid services were under enormous pressure across the nation, and struggled to take on NDIS appeals.", "\"People who are extremely disadvantaged, and then they're walking into a room sitting opposite high-powered lawyers who are treating them almost like you would expect corporate lawyers to treat each other,\" Roen said.", "\"The power imbalance is immense.", "\"You can't expect a person with disability to be going up against that on their own.\"", "
Minister dodges questions, agency denies cost-cutting
", "The ABC contacted NDIS Minister Linda Reynolds for an interview regarding the rise in cases before the AAT, but she declined.", "Ms Reynolds was again asked for an interview regarding Laura Thatcher's case, but did not respond.", "The NDIA did not respond to all of the ABC's questions regarding Laura Thatcher, including why she was denied funding for supported accommodation and if it was appropriate for her grandmother to be her full-time carer.", "However, in a statement, an agency spokesperson said the NDIS \"continues to provide a significant level of funding for Ms Thatcher's disability-related supports\".", "\"The NDIA are making contact with Ms Thatcher's family to reassure them the agency will continue to work with them to meet Ms Thatcher's support needs,\" the statement read.", "\"Following a recent request for accommodation support, the NDIA\u00a0is working with the family to identify suitable funded accommodation, including short- and longer-term solutions.", "\"The total number of AAT applications represents a very small number of the more than 480,000 NDIS Participants benefiting from the Scheme.\"", "The spokesperson also downplayed the rise in appeals before the AAT.", "\"The number of applications remains steady as a proportion of the overall number of participants in the scheme at between 0.43 per cent and 0.45 per cent\u00a0since 2017-18 (to June 30),\" the spokesperson said.", "\"The NDIA continues to work to improve the NDIS for participants, as well as their families and carers, to ensure a better scheme experience.", "\"This includes meeting the time frames with which we handle any participant complaint or appeal.\""]
